description: Shows the multi geocoding API response results.

address.description: Summarizes the result of converting an address to coordinates.

result.description: Indicates whether the search result was successful.

count.description: Indicates the total number of search results. For example, if the length of the [id, query] array sent in the request body is 10 but the actual search results are 8, the count value is returned as 8.

items.description: Indicates the search results corresponding to the request id.

reqid.description: Has a 1:1 relationship with the id included in the request body and is a unique id to identify multi geocoding results.

admcount.description: Indicates the number of search results found.

items.description: Represents the result of converting an address to coordinate values.

type.description: Indicates the search type. 1 means administrative district search, 2 means lot number search, 3 means new address search.

roadname.description: Indicates the new address road name.

roadjibun.description: Indicates the road name address lot number.

postcode.description: Indicates the postal code. Appears when searching address and lot number together.

buildname.description: Indicates the building number. Appears when searching address and lot number together with road name address.

accuracy.description: Indicates the accuracy of the lot number. 0 means exact search, 1 means sub-lot extension, 2 means main lot extension, 3 means administrative district search.

header.description: Shows the status of the API response result.

isSuccessful.description: Indicates whether the API request was successful.

resultCode.description: Indicates the API response result code. Returns 0 on success, otherwise indicates failure. Major result codes: 0(success), 100(Result Not Found), 101(Argument Error), 102(Internal Server Error), 103(Different Map Version), 201(Searching for Security), 202(Longitude/Latitude), 203(Mobile Phone Number), 300(AppKey Error), 400(Taxi Fare Info not Found), 501(Unknown Fail), 517(Memory allocation failure), 532(Request parameter is invalid), 533(Starting point not selected), 534(Destination not selected), 537(Exceeding navigational distance), 540(Expansion failure due to traffic control), etc.

resultMessage.description: Indicates the reason for response failure when the API response fails. Major result messages include: "Result Not Found", "Argument Error", "Internal Server Error", "Different Map Version", "AppKey Error", "Searching for Security", "Longitude/Latitude", "Mobile Phone Number", "Unknown Fail", "Memory allocation failure", "Request parameter is invalid", "The starting point is not selected", "Destination is not selected", "Exceeding the navigational distance", "Expansion failure due to inactivity or traffic control", etc., providing specific error causes for proper exception handling.
